review: I'm going to keep my review simple, broken up into points. - Waiter had major BO. Nearly killed my appetite every time he came by. - Didn't get drinks until we reminded him. - I asked for well done, friend asked for medium. I got medium, he got well done.  - Asked them to bring out our French onion soup first. Brought out burgers instead, and forgot about the French onion soup. Told them to forget the soup at this point. Then waiter made it seem like it was the chefs fault?  - Again, the waiters body odor nearly killed me as time went on.  - Burgers came back, and mine is STILL wrong. Oh, and the fries were cold. Go figure. Manager eventually comped us as they should have. I wouldn't be surprised if they spit in our food at this point for you know... Making them do their jobs right. Basically, stay far away from this place. If I could give it a 0 I would. No wonder why they closed down the first time.

The most horrible place to eat on Staten Island. Everything about this place is horrible. First off, we came as a table of 3 and asked for seats at 7pm. They told us an hr and 15 minutes, we come back 10 minutes before that time is up and they told us it's going to be another half an hr. So basically it was an hour 35 minutes. While we were waiting, we overheard the hostess say there were empty tables of 4 but they' weren't seating us because there are parties of 4 that aren't here yet.  So we finally sit down and looked over the rather small and menu and ordered our food and drinks. Our soda was flat and we had to send it back 3 times before deciding there is no good soda here. Then it took 45 minutes to bring us 3 simple burgers. When we got it, the burgers were cold. The bun, the cheese, the fries were cold. The meat was overcooked and the overall burgers were bland even with bacon and sauce. We all saw the bottom of the bottomless fries and was not offered refills despite their "bottomless steak fries" advertisement everywhere. The eating utensils were dirty and full of water spots. The plates were oily and sticky. How can a place be this filthy within 2 weeks of restaurant opening? Overall, I will never return here and I do not recommend Red Robin ever again.

I couldn't wait to eat at Red Robin when i found the mall was getting one. i finally got my chance tonight. going in i had high hopes. After waiting for 20 minutes to be seated we finally got to our seats and decided to order some burgers, i got a bacon cheeseburger and fries. as soon as i got my food i knew i was in for something not good. the bacon was not fully cooked, i asked for medium well but instead got medium raw but the outside was crispy almost like it was burnt. The bun isn't something to brag about either, probably one of the worse burgers i have eaten. next time ill just go to five guys.

Didn't read any of the reviews before eating here, which is unusual for myself, but I was in a mall Christmas shopping and seen the place so decided to eat here rather than Applebee's that's right across from it. My options were limited, it was either here or the food court. I came in because of the commercial (yum!) we came in early, for lunch maybe 12ish, was seated right away because the place was pretty empty; it started to fill up after we were seated. Right away the waitress came over took our drink orders, and asked if we had any questions about the menu. My husband ordered the burger, I ordered the prime rib sandwich with French onion soup, both were very tasty, and my husband enjoyed his burger. The menu was smaller than I thought it would be, and it's kind of confusing, couldn't get the gist of the appetizer options. I would go again...if and when I'm in the mall, and let's just say I can't stand this mall...plus they had my angry orchard beer, so that was a plus.

This place is beyond bad. And to be soo bad soo soon is a real concern. It usually takes a poorly managed, inherently bad establishment about 6 months to show its true color, but this one seems to have accomplished that in a few weeks.  I tried to eating there twice hoping my first experience was just a bad night, but I was wrong. On my first visit my burger had a foul taste and it was served on a cold damp hard pretzel bun.  When the imported manager seeing my dish picked apart in my attemp to salvage something ask how It was and I said really bad. Her reply, "Oh well, sorry". Not sure how folks in Iowa feel, but in NY with a place like this on every corner, that won't fly. On my second visit my wife's sweet potato fries were frozen, the roll on my French dip was hard and stale and my fries were hard and cold. Oh I did get a teaspoon full of cole slaw and all for the shocking price of $14.00. Even if it wasn't old, stale and bad it wouldn't have been worth that. The wait staff is mostly confused but very polite. I assume most are imported as well, but I'm sure the politeness will fad when locals take over and are deluged by complaints on a daily basis. Sorry Applebees for thanking god for another option in the mall, but you should be happy. This place makes you look like a 5 star establishment.

I went here for Veteran's Day and there was already a wait for a table at 1pm. My pal suggested eating at the (small) bar which had a few seats available. As a vet I only qualified for the free Tavern Double Burger with bottomless steak fries while my pal had a Bacon Guacamole  Burger and onion rings. My burger was OK at best and to me pretty much tasted like a McDonald's double cheeseburger. The fries were good. My pal however raved about his B/G burger. I have to compliment our bar person Daphne who was excellent and there is a good selection of draft beers. I got a take-out order of spinach and artichoke dip and for $7 there wasn't much dip there. So overall a positive experience with room for improvement.

The service here is decent. The decor is cool and the beer shakes are fabulous but the biggest problem here is the food. I guess I was expecting gourmet burgers because that is Red Robin's motto. How wrong I was. The toppings and bun are awesome but the food is far from gourmet. The burger meat is horrible and tastes like cardboard. You can tell right away that it is not fresh meat. Do not plan on a good quality burger when you go here, plan on fast food. Like Wendy's or McDonalds. They are just pricier and have a larger variety of toppings.

To describe this place in one word i would  say horrible.   where do i start? 1.sloppy waitstaff in casual clothes 2. hour long waits  3. filthy menus  4. forgetful waitstaff  5. do they was their plates and utensils ? was excited to come here to eat but i would rather take the ride to jersey then come to this one again. this place needs management it doesn't look like theres anyone there taking control. with a million workers there at a time how could one restaurant be such a mess?  will i come here again ? no i will not.  and i suggest others not to either you will be very disappointed
My first time at red robin I was so excited to eat here but I'm leaving so disappointed the food was horrible my server was very nice but I will never come back to red robin

Sorry, Red Robin, but you're just getting worse instead of better.  Our 4th visit was yesterday and it was pretty bad.  Hostesses up front have been clueless on every visit.  3 of them with their heads together trying to figure things out.  You have to stand on top of them to get their attention.  We got seated next to a bussing station where a mob of busboys with lots of time on their hands were very loud and obnoxiously yakking and banging on a garbage can.  We got up and moved to another table and complained to a manager who apologized.  Next, the women's restroom was filthy.  Dirty toilets, empty paper rolls, paper all over the floor, and overflowing gargage can.  Next, our burgers were overdone and not hot by the time they got to our table.  Had to send the food runner back for sauce she forgot to bring.  I should have looked at the check more carefully, too, because we got charged for salad which should have been a free substitution with our burgers.  On 3 out of 4 visits it was obvious that the servers don't know the menu.  When (if ever) is someone going to do some TRAINING in this place?  No one knows what they're doing!!  I was originally hoping to go for the perks of the Red Robin Royalty program but I am losing patience with this place and might just forget about ever going back.  It seems all the employees here are too young, too inexperienced, and too lacking in plain and simple manners to do their jobs well.  Bye-bye, Red Robin!!

Like so many, I was excited about Red Robin coming to the SI Mall. I usually drive to Jersey when I'm in the mood for quality burgers which in the past they always served. However, this time I was unsatisfied. I expected much more because it's a new place. You just assume they will try harder and be at the top of their game. Not the case, unfortunately. First of all, the service left a lot to be desired. We had to wait almost 35 min. for a table and then were seated at a huge round table for 6 right smack in the center of everything (we were 2 adults and a 5 yr old). Needless to say we weren't happy. When we told the maître'd we wanted to sit elsewhere (there was an empty booth a few feet away, she went to the manager (brown haired girl with a pony tail - this was sunday nite around 7pm) who informed us that we couldn't have the booth because there were people on the way for it. I then remarked that didn't know one could reserve a table at RedRobin - I would have requested a booth when I first walked in. She then said that I couldn't do that. You have to take what's available. Huh? I was puzzled. When I tried to push it she changed her tune and said it had to do with the number of tables assigned to each server. The bottom line is that it was just ridiculous how bad their customer service is. The maitre'd didn't know what to say when pressed and clearly the person to blame was the manager. She was just plain rude. So we wound up sitting at this uncomfortable table and the meal started off badly. The irony is that the booth we wanted sat empty for 25 min. while we ate. It was then given to 3 teenagers who didn't strike me like they had called in advance for it. Advice to Red Robin - I have driven to Jersey with my family numerous times to eat at Red Robin but I will never return to your SI mall location. You don't treat a customer with a family that way. If your staff is amateurish and ill mannered then perhaps you should provide more training because they will ruin your business. That being said, the burgers were dry and lackluster. Also, I ordered a side of coleslaw and the tiny amount they give you should really just be complimentary or give a bit more because a thimbleful is just absurd. There is such a thing as being too greedy, guys. I was so disappointed because this would have been my go to place to eat during my Xmas shopping excursions.

The short version is very poor service, quality of the burgers is poor and a very long wait. I would never recommend this place or eat her again. Do not waste your time, patience or money here .  The beginning of the incompetent was with the hostess who act as if she had no idea what was going on with the tables and couldn't seat us yet. I had a very long wait, close to one hour for 3 people. Next the general service was poor, our waters took a good amount of time to come out. The burgers we ordered were not cooked the way we asked, we all ordered medium rare but received charred, tasteless and dry burgers. This is when the service got bad on their part. My girlfriend had asked for more water, and the busboy decided to stand next to the manager with another bus boy, conversing in the middle on the restaurant. I'm glad i didn't noticed that the bus boy that was asked to get water for us was the one that was standing there, but i eventually got up and asked for it. The best part was he replied to us" i was gonna tell your waiter to get it". I was just stunned by this, because generally that is part of a busies job. I don't expect to be pampered, but it seemed as if the structure of jobs is not held, they have a lot of kids hired that are standing around.

It couldn't be clearer that this scam chain has no consideration about customer satisfaction. I ordered a basic barbecue burger medium rare and all I got was a piece of meat that tasted as if it were in a possible kitchen fire. I really felt as though I was eating some type of black drywall. Besides the food, the service was unbelievable. I really still can't believe that it took 2 employees and 1 manager to take my friend's girlfriend's order of a cup of water. Not only did it take the 3 (1+2=3) of them to collaborate to realize what she had ordered, but when one of them had finally brought it, they had quite the attitude. I really don't want to get too much into detail about my experience at Red Roberts but it is clear that I will not be returning. I just feel like I wasted more than my money here.. Case closed.
The service was horrible and the food was "so so". Price was very reasonable but I guess you get what you pay for!
What a waste of time, place was terrible ,from the waiter to the manager this place will be closed before next summer. Don't spend your money on this isht hole .

We've been here twice. Both times our burgers came out cold. The second time our server was MIA for over 20 minutes and didn't bother to pre-bus our table when dropping off the check. The staff are more interested in goofing around with each other than taking care of the customers. Never again.

Have been to other red robins before and this one was by far the worst. Poor service. Poor service is enough to make me not go back. The food was great and no problems with the food at all. Just the service. I was told about a loyalty club my server was going to sign me up for and didn't. Just like he forgot to bring out my dessert my mother in law ordered for my birthday. The table wasn't bused between appetizers and the meals. He was no where around when I wanted to order another drink. When we asked for a to go box we got it. Just no bag. It was like the server couldn't get rid of us fast enough once we asked for a to go box because he handed us the check with it.We did want dessert but since the check had  been handed to us and I was annoyed already I paid and left. The only reason I tipped him was because I'm a waitress at a restaurant and know what this kid is probably making an hour.

Service is horrendous. Ordered an appetizer and burgers. 30 minutes later, no appetizer or burger. Waiter never even came by to check on us the entire time. Saw a group who came after us get their food. We decided to just walk out at that point.  Wish we would have read all these negative reviews before going there. Horrible experience - don't waste your time or your money.

I'm surprised at all of the negative reviews. I have been here a few times already,since it had opened,I ordered different things each time..a few appetizers,different dishes,including the burger,and I found everything to be delicious,as did everyone who I came with. The service was excellent each time,as well. Different waiters/waitresses and they were all very attentive,gave me what I asked for,and were great. The dessert was also awesome! I'm surprised at all the negativity about this place,I give everything an A++....

To be honest, I love the royal robin burger here. That's the only good thing I have to say about red robin. Service is nasty. Word of advice, please hire people that actually need a job rather than those that get hired by chance that don't care. Really, like come one not only have I gotten bad service ONCE but TWICE, while giving it a second Chance.  First time, we take our seats, table is dirty, waitress comes and I can tell already she was not very outgoing and rude. Later on, I ask for water and she kept on walking by forgetting my water while giving the guy across from me a water. So I tell her again and she walked away obnoxiously as if I said something wrong. Not very pleasant! Second time, we take our seats, table is dirty so our waitress switches our seat with a sarcastic tone. Anyway, she seemed very nice, so when we got the check, we were deciding to give her more tip than we usually do (which is 20%). Bill was $35, we put $40, while getting out more singles for tip but she automatically grabbed it without asking us or asking if we needed the change. We were waiting to put a few dollars more when we get the $5 change but nooooo instead we look back and she says "do you need anything else?" Answering her own question", have a good day now" wow did that set me off. Boyfriend and I had our jaws dropped, in complete shock. We were going to go to the manager but figured that this whole place is crap and if you hired these amateurs than I'm sure the manager must be just like them. That food wasn't worth the service.  P.s. don't forget the hostess. Both times they sucked. They are very slow to adapting to what you are saying. First time, she looked at us like we speaked gibberish. Second time, we walk in, guy that looks like manager greets us but he sees the hostess are not talking to us, busy looking at a paper and talking amongst each other, not acknowledging us at all, he walks away without saying anything to them. Then I ask them about royal club card and then she asks me are you eating here tonight? I'm like yeah and then they ignore us again to talk then finally, "follow me, no wait, one minute... Okay now, follow me" Is this a joke?! It certainly is. God help this place.

Horrible service this place is such a disappointment. The food took 20 minutes for a simple burger and grilled chicken. And the most disturbing part was a manager was standing an arms length away and could see our disappointment and just stood there like she didn't want to be there. When this place first opened a manager came around all the time and now they just don't care and it shows in the service and quality.

My experience here was not bad at all and service was okay. Maybe it's because it wasn't as crowded when my boyfriend and I went. I had the whiskey river burger with fries and he had the guacamole bacon burger with fries. Both burgers were good and delicious. Our food came to us at a decent wait time. We ordered pretzel bites and wings as appetizers. The pretzel bites were okay; I wouldn't order it again. The wings were finger licking good especially with the yummy sauce. I did get a bit annoyed at the end though when our server handed us the check when we still had food on the table and we never asked for the check. Overall my experience was good. It's my first time here and I'll probably go back for the wings if I ever get around travelling to Staten Island to shop again. :)

We had to wait in line for our table, but I find their waiting service very nice. They would text you when your table is ready, which allows you to walk around the mall.  Our waitress was nice and friendly. When our food was taking a while to get here, she would notify us even though we didn't ask.  I ordered a freckled lemonade, which is minute maid lemonade with strawberries, nothing special but it does taste good. We got the Shorty Rings which comes in 6 pieces with two different sauce, love the orange sauce. I ordered the Royal Red Robin burger, which was good but gets very messy. My boyfriend ordered the California Chicken burger, which also look good but don't know what it taste like. They do have different sides for the burger, so if you don't want fries then you can definitely get something else.

HORRIBLE  place has terrible service waited  20 minutes for just 2 people and place wasn't even packed our waiter "rocky" was horrible and slow didn't give us utensils and only took care of other people other than us my advice go next door to Applebee's

After shopping with my brother-in-law and niece, we decided to come to Red Robins for lunch where we met up with mutual friends. Service was no existent, we were with kids and it was not worth being here. 20 minutes to be seen for our order is ridiculous. I admit that the food I ordered (grilled chicken wrap) was delicious.

Great burgers. You can tell open flames touched the meat! So good. So so good... That's assuming you get your burger before if gets cold waiting in the kitchen for pickup. The service was disorganized, but friendly. I didn't get forks or a napkin and my wife had to go grab it elsewhere. But we got refills before asking, so that is a plus. Two stars for service but four stars for the burgers! The fries were nothing special but next time I will ask if they have curly fries. Onion rings were great. Will go back until service gets really bad.

Decent food but horrible service. Waited an hour and when it was our turn to be seated the person at the front desk had no one to seat us. We had to wait another 5-10 minutes. When we finally got to our seats and ordered our food everything was great until the food came.   There wasn't any silverware on the table or napkins so we had to wait until the wait staff came back. Then someone at our table (of 3) didn't get half their order. We waited another 15 minutes before our waitress came back to tell her. When we told her she says sorry then disappears. We wait another 10-15 minutes our waitress not even in sight so we ask another waiter.  So we have another 10 minute wait. Finally a random waitress tells the manager and he takes care of it. The staff here just seems to not care and just straight up disappear. Also the endless fries? Never even got the chance to ask for more(if I wanted any) since the wait staff just disappears after you get your order. The food wasn't amazing and it's definitely not worth the wait. First time in my life not leaving a tip.

Horrible service.  Waitress Christine was s total nightmare.  Never in my life have I gotten such poor service anywhere.  The restaurant was not even crowded so it cannot be because of that.  Never again !

What the fudge was I thinking not coming here ? I love fries and especially that they are bottomless here then thats a plus. The food came out hot enough and the waiter was cool . The only thing is that whomever is running that cleaning in there needs a new hobby. Ketchup on the seats and booths not really clean. Floor a mess and there was dirty silver wear . Ehhhh I guess I can't really complain . It's a family place .

Got the pretzel bites with cheese dip for an appetizer. It was quite good and came out really fast. Had to wait a bit for the turkey burger though. What's nice are the bottomless fries and dipped in their honey mustard sauce! So good!

After countless commercials on local television*, the greater New York area finally has a Red Robin location.  Firstly, really Yelpers of Staten Island? Some of the commentary on this page is not to be believed. I think what is missed here is that Red Robin is in fact a chain restaurant. You aren't stepping into the next big thing when it comes to 'gourmet burgers,' but instead are dealing with a glorified Burger King. When you're shopping in the Staten Island Mall, don't try to find that too shocking.  As for the food, it's okay. It's on the same page as other nearby chain establishments like Applebees, TGIF, and others. You mostly dine places like this to get an affordable meal when you're out and about. I do agree that the wait times are a bit crazy at the moment seeing as they've just opened, but to try something new it was worth the extra 15 minutes or so. I got the Whiskey River BBQ burger and it was fairly tasty. Doused in solid, zesty sauce and topped with crispy fried onions it was disgustingly satisfying. I love the idea of bottomless fries to quell my need for an exuberant amount of carbohydrates in one sitting. For the frequently mentioned service, I didn't find it to be better or worse than any other restaurant in the area. Our waiter was actually quite pleasant and attentive even though the dining room was extremely busy. When we sat down I was feeling a bit woozy from not eating all day and requested my fries arrive as soon as possible. They came piping hot within minutes! We also split a salted caramel shake and instead of bring one large cup and two straws, he nicely had it separated and garnished**, with the salted caramel (which was too salty, sorry RR), and huge dollops of whipped cream.  Overall, I don't see what all the negative fuss is about on this business' Yelp page. I wish them success and if I'm ever desperate in the Staten Island Mall I wouldn't mind stopping in again. *I'm a complete sucker for moving pictures of fake-ly glazed burgers. **Yes I used garnished in a Red Robin review...

Great service & the food is always yummy. Make sure to try the freckled lemonade (it's bottomless!), skip the steak fries cause they're gross. Order the sweet potato fries instead. I always get the whisky bbq burger, it's divine!

As you can read from many of the other reviews, the service is very bad. The restaurant is located in Staten Island so perhaps this is why they can't get decent waitstaff who are friendly and helpful. They are more interested in texting their friends and goofing off instead of working. I blame the poor management for the lack of supervision.

This was my second time there first time when it first opened it was speedy service food was delicious second time not the same the floor was disgusting the silverware was dirty the restrooms was disgusting the food was bland I even got burned crumbs from the bottom of the deep fryer the waiter was walking around like he was lost I can guarantee you it's not the same cook the worse $70 I have ever spent

Possibly the WORST service I've ever encountered. I felt pretty stupid recommending we go here, since we were supposed to go to our usual place Applebee's right across the way. Long story short, our waitress Bianca or Brenda or something with a B, looked about as excited to be there as she was to have a root canal. We were seated in the corner and then literally forgotten about. Not a single person came over to ask us if we needed something, how our food was, nada. I went here once before and have to say I enjoyed the burger, so I ordered it again. Ten years later, we had a different girl deliver our cheeseburgers, which we all ordered and had asked to be cooked differently. So how the hell were we supposed to know which burger was which? The moron's answer "Oh, I don't know. The guy in the back knows by looking at it." So, is he going to take a bite out of my burger to see which one is well done and which one was medium rare? Can he see through the burger?Then she disappeared, one burger got sent back and we waited almost half an hour for a new one. I also got to hear the never ending complaining from my family, how this place "Sucks and the food is terrible." Those were the words from an 81 year old. So on that note, I will pass on this place. The burger isn't that great to put up with really shitty service from a bunch of high schoolers.

Believe the reviews that state ok to very good food and HORRIBLE service.  Was here a few months ago and had a terrible experience, had to chase down wait staff, waited forever for the food, food order for 7 year old came wrong, took another 20 minutes to get the right thing, etc.  I vowed never to return.  But my son liked his little pizza and the free balloon (you know how kids are) so I figured we would give it another chance. Went back last night with my husband and 2 sons.  Same story as the last time, only worse.  When we walked in no hostess was around, she showed up at least 5 minutes later, said she would be right back, another bit of time, she came back to seat us.  Then just like our last visit 3 months ago, no wait service to be found for 12 minutes (timed it this time). We ordered our food and did get our drinks pretty quickly.  But then you wait and wait, you never see your wait staff again, and you wait some more.  As we were looking around the room, we could see many people complaining to various staff, others walking out after waiting for wait staff, others walking out after waiting for food for an hour (for appetizer).  I would have walked out too but my kids were hungry and it's hard to explain to them that we've been waiting to long.  APPETIZERS finally came after about 45 min, food followed that another half an hour later.  Overall, 2 hour meal, most of that time spent waiting.  We also had no silverware or napkins on our table, I spilled my drink while waiting and had to go through my purse looking for a tissue to wipe up the spill.  Food was ok when it came, a bit cold from sitting around.  It didn't come with the side of bbq sauce that I ordered and the amount of fries in my little cup holder was anemic.  LIke others have said, what good is bottomless fries if you can never find any staff to order them?  I will say that our waitress was pleasant and seemed to be trying to do a good job and I give her credit for a decent attitude when so many people are complaining.  Not sure what the problem is here, but think that there are many, front of the house needs to get in order and obviously there is some type of problem in the kitchen.   If you are looking for this type of food, honestly, go across the aisle to Applebees. I can't believe that this place will stay in business at this locale for long if this keeps up.  I really felt badly for people sitting there for over an hour with no food who had small kids with them........just terrible......

We have been here several times. We love the food, but the service is horrible.  We did get seated right away and given menus. Then we waited. Finally came to take our order. He said he would bring our water, but had to wait for silverware because they just got washed.  Took awhile for water to come.  We timed how long our meal took. It was 35 minutes before our main meal came.

The food at Red Robin was excellent and flavorful , the portions are a good size as well, however the service is not consistent and makes you feel rushed at times. The Teriyaki Burger I ordered was very good too. They also have various Beer shakes if your ambitious enough to try it.

I do love their veggie burgers and they have gluten free buns which I like. I do love their food except the service last time was very slow my friend waited till after she finished her food for her shake. I mean i dont think it was the waiters fault. He was very respectful and nice to us. he just took a while to bring everything and bringing my friends drink after she finishes eating in not right. I feel that this place needs more workers here and maybe it will result in better service. I would come here again though.
Food was ok at best, but the waitress was horrible. She seemed disinterested in working and the place was dirty. The floors were so greasy that we were slipping on the floor.

Worst Place Ever....TOTALLY! First time, Only time & Last time there!... Our waiter was like if he was doing us a favor... I mean really? Its just burgers dude? Maybe that's why he had that face lol...  Advice for you dude; Go to school and choose another career! ... you killed my buzz for red robin!

Rarely ever do I follow suite with nearly all of the previous reviews, but this Red Robin has a serious issue.....service.   I've been to handful of Red Robins in multiple states and this is by far, the worst experience I've had. The waitress was extremely nice, but, despite an empty restaurant, and I do mean empty, our food, 2 burgers, took 30-40 minutes.  After what proved to be an eternity to receive our food, BOTH of our orders were incorrect.   Dear Red Robin Gourmet Burger headquarters, listen up! The kitchen staff at this location either need to ALL be fired, or they need an intensive retraining session.  Let's be honest, the cooks and expediting stations are not making complicated meals, they are primarily making burgers and fries.  To say that the wait time for the burgers is unacceptable is an understatement and I can guarantee that if you do not address and bring in some veterans to run the kitchen properly, this business will fail.  I was shocked to hear that this location has already been open for 8 months; the mistakes that were made were rookie mistakes, something simply doesn't add up. Needless to say, I will not be revisiting this location anytime soon. The food, well, it was I expect from Red Robin, good burgers, but not good enough to keep me waiting over a half hour.

The food at Red Robin is excellent but the service is unbelievably bad. We waited and waited and waited and then the food came. The wrong food. Waiter tells me he's sorry but the manager let most if the staff take the day off. Think he needs to go back to business school.

This is a great place to go eat a meal The best part is free refills on sodas and The bottomless fries  Good selection of burgers and chicken Great kids menu also  A lot of great choices for kids as well as adults They have a nice selection of alcohol beverages
Good food. Bad service, the food took 45 minutes to come out and even that came out before our drinks lol..it is as pretty bad if the food wasn't good I'd give it 1 star

The food was horrible and disgusting full of greasy. The service was horrible if you get the waiter named Jeremy expect to be there for 2 or more hours he thinks who he is and rushes and drops the food on your lap. The only think is good there is the desserts.  I would recommend going to the red robin in Woodbridge that one is much better and go to Applebee's

My second time dining here and both times I came around 2 pm and both times they were understaffed.  Took them 10 minutes to seat us today with nobody ahead of us and the restaurant was only 20% full. Food was good,  but the two servers were hopping around trying to keep up. HIRE MORE SERVERS.

My wife and child went here last night. Apps were fine (onion ring tower/yukon chips) but the service was very slow. Ordered a shake for our son, took over ten minutes to come out. We order our food (two burgers) and explicity asked for well done. They came out pink inside, not just a little or in the center, these suckers were rare. We just kiboshed the whole deal and went to Wendys since the wait for the drinks/food was painfully slow. I gave two stars for the apps and the decor inside, there were pictures on the ceiling, zany!

Today was the first time I went to Red Robin and it will be my last. I went there this evening with my boyfriend and a friend of ours, and let me express my great dissatisfaction of my experience there.  First we walked in and the hostess greeted us with an attitude. As a hostess and the first person I see when I walk into an establishment (especially for the first time) I should be greeted with a smile, a "How are you?" and asking how many will be in my party. Not me having to initiate the conversation. We were told we had to wait 20-25 minutes, which, at the time, was fine after seeing a few people in the waiting area already when we walked in. 20 minutes go by and we sit down, however, we see not one person actually leave the restautant (and there's only was entrance and exit because this location is set up in a mall and the mall was already closed, our mall closes at 6PM on Sundays.) We finally sat down and I count that there are 14 tables in total and more than half of them could have sat 3 people and no one had left the restaurant!  I would understand if it was a Saturday and dinner time, or even if it was busy tonight, but it wasn't! As I looked around at the empty tables, 3 of them weren't cleaned, including one next to us. Our waitress finally came over and never introduced herself or welcomed us to the restaurant she didn't even seem like she wanted to be there in any way. After waiting for our drinks to come (which took about 15 minutes) the tables still weren't cleaned and there were absolutely no bus boys or anyone else making an attempt to clean them!! Still not knowing our waitresses name, she was subpar and didn't understand my order or the menu item of the combo salad with a soup. I ordered a Caesar salad with a Tortilla Chip Soup and she said "So you want a Caesar Wrap" as a statement and not a question. I corrected her and even though she seemed confused as anything she thankfully she got my order right.  Half an hour goes by and we get our food. The 2 burgers that my boyfriend and friend ordered were decent, not the best and the fries weren't even hot. The salad and soup I got was ok. Nothing amazing for $10. The salad was small and the soup was way to cheesey  and the chicken within it tasted fake and rubbery beyond belief. The menu item itself is misleading to say it had vegetables whereas it only has corn.  Now that we're almost done with our food at this point, the food that had been sitting at the table next to us the whole time still hasn't been cleared along with the other tables! Our waitress at no point came over to us and checked how we were and when she did she didn't even ask if we wanted refills on the fries that came with the other 2 orders or our drinks. As she started to take the plates away we had to say that we wanted refills on the fries and she seemed baffled and took the plates away and brought us more fries. Finally when it came time to get the check (we finally learned the name of the waitress off of the receipt) she tosses the check holder onto the table! After the tedious wait of about 25 minutes for her to come back and forth, we're finally able to leave. After this horrible experience, I will NEVER come back to Red Robin. The service, waitresses, and entire  knowledge of the staff needs to be greatly assessed because this was probably one of the worst experiences I EVER had in my life!!!

Absolutely terrible service. The tables were all broken, could not move without fear of spilling my glass over. The prices were high for such low quality food. I feel like the bottomless fries and root beer floats are the scam to get you in. The secret to the root beer floats is they will take their sweet time to bring it out to you and you will fill up before you need another. Would not recommend this to anyone looking for a good burger at a reasonable price and diverse bar selection. 1 star for my 1 root beer float

Never ate here before and never will again.  Burgers just a slight step up from Macdonald's.  Bus boy wiped a dirty table next to ours and he just threw the dirty food remnants onto the chairs and floor.  Didn't even wipe the table properly and didn't even wipe the chairs that still had food on them when we left!  Just gross.  Had to send back a cheeseburger the cheese wasn't melted at all and the fries were cold.  Not really difficult to melt cheese and serve hot fries the place wasn't even busy.  Awful!

Current mood: Eating my feelings.... Well...Red Robin was good....red robin is a fast food chain restaurant...Iv seen it in commercials and driving by while visiting other states.... but I haven't seen one around nyc until now.. This restaurant has been in my area for almost two years now and I finally tired it ... There prices are on the high side due to the quality....they only have a tiny carry out/delivery section all the way at the back of the restaurant....And the service and the wait is crazy....about 25 minute wait during lunch hour and refills aren't consent...they screw up on what I needed.... I had to call the waitress every time I needed a refill...it was such a pain in the ass....don't like the serivce or the wait...the tables were extremely wobbly...did like the atmosphere and the food was pretty decent so here's my A ok ..... Anyway....very filling...hope you guys enjoy your burgers!

SERVICE IS HORRID! Now that I got a persons attention and gave fair warning I wish I read others comments before going to this red robin in staten island mall. Next time I'll make the LONGER trip to New Jersey or to Long Island. I went cause I figured it would be just as good as other locations. I have no idea who manages this location or owns this franchise but it's bound to fail if they don't fix this issue. Place was barely full and had to wait around for 15 minutes. I walk in to see plenty of open tables. Then they try to seat me near this corner table which was so tight but was allowed to change once they cleaned another table. Yes tight and yes cause perhaps I'm TO FAT and yes I should stop complaining I can't fit in that booth and not go there but already there and I'm a foodie. Well I order my drinks along with some wings which had no sauce on them not to mention that they mention you can get dipping sauces. Waited around hoping for server to come, yes the place was still somewhat not busy. Almost ate my wings, another person brings food and I ask about my dipping sauce & was told they'll ask my server, the server returns & asks what do I want? Really.? I'm wondering if it was written down, I'm asked what do I want so I said I'd need to see menu then states to me that now they recall and will get it. Now for my food complaint, yes the allure is bottomless fries which are great if you can get them here cause by time my server came back I just ate what my girlfriend left. I was fed up waiting for service. I know if it was busy it would be a reason. Got the prime rib dip but sandwich was COLD and so was my girlfriend burger. My sandwich had cheese which cause it got colder the cheese started,to coagulate. Service was slow that my girlfriend got up to go get a bottle of ketchup from another table for use. The hostess seemed overwhelmed or confused of what to do when I was waiting on line with others waiting as well. My server seemed annoyed but to be fair it's January first and maybe tired from partying or I should just not judge cause after all I seldom saw them come to my table! Speaking of lack of service I could even hear the couple that came in when I was almost done complain that they were disappointed in service and felt they should've gone next door to eat there. I should've have too or just go down the road to other places if not the food court.

This is the third time that my wife and I have gone to the Red Robin on Staten Island. The first time the food was terrible and we didn't get what we ordered. The service was also very slow. The second time, the greeter was nasty and impolite. The third time (tonight) service was again slow, my wife didn't get what she ordered and I was giving the incorrect change. Overall the food is not worth it and the service needs work. I don't know if the problem is with the service or with the kitchen.
Never would of guessed a chain burger place was any good. Average service but oddly good.
Good food.  Service is ok.  Prices are reasonably low.  Appetizers are decent sized.  Bottomless root beer floats.  Bottomless fries.

My family and I were here Sunday, March 8. The service was terrible, we were constantly looking for our waitress. I had to flag her down after 20 min so we could finally place our order. My son was literally gagging while eating his kids meal burger and said that it didn't taste good. When we finished our meal, we ordered 3 milkshakes to go (one kid size, 2 regular size). The waitress brought us our shakes and the cups were only filled half way. When I asked why the adult shakes were the same size as the kid shake, she said for some reason that's just the way the guy in the back did it. I asked for them to add more and she gave me an attitude. An hour after we left, my son ended up getting sick and after speaking to the other people in our group, everyone who ordered a burger got sick. I've eaten at Red Robin many times but this was my first time at this location. I will NEVER eat here again. The meat was obviously no good and the service was awful!

Place was almost empty for 6pm so i should have seen that as a sign.  4 of us ordered simple things...took 25 minutes to get food. 1 order wrong, 1 order cold, 1 order awful anx dried out. Waitress ran after dropping food and  couldn't  find her to fix order nor get drink refills nor more french fries.  Also forgot to  mention place was a mess..many tables dirty and dishes not cleared in an empty restaurant?  Long wait to get my check.  I've been to great red robins...this is not one of them..I'd be careful about eating here with such poor habits
Food is great. Service sucks always slow I figured maybe after my 15th visit it might change but that didn't happen  I don't blame the servers  I think it's management that is always short servers.

Went here again last night, with a friend. Once again, the food was great. They specialize in burgers here, and they really do a great job. The burgers also come with never ending fries, so I got a couple orders of them. The burger was awesome, the fries were good. Service: Our order took about 15 minutes to be brought to us. I did ask for my burger to be well done, and I think 15 minutes is reasonable, I take about 8 minutes to cook a burger at home, and I don't make it well done, so 15 minutes is reasonable. Price: Red Robin, please do something about the price. My burger was 10.29, not the worst, but alittle high, considering I can buy 4 burgers for $7 at supermark to make on my own grill, my friend's burger was 13.99, and he ordered a drink which was 4.49 (a lemonade drink, not an alcoholic drink).. So at the end of the meal, I was satisfied, my burger was really good, and a nice size, I had 2 orders of fries, so maybe that makes up for the higher price. My friend however was extremely pissed off, he wound up putting in $22 for his share of the order and tax/tip. He was pissed and said he doesn't want to come here any more. $22 for a burger and lemonade is ridiculous, without the tip his share still would of cost $19. I don't think anyone should pay $19 for a burger and lemonade. other than the price, this place in my opinion, is the best place to eat in the staten island mall and its area of neighboring restaurants across the street.

Nothing like walking up to red robins and seeing half the staff outside smoking and then when it's time to order they are either by the bathroom sitting on there phones and texting, no concern for the customers.. Prices were a bit high for burgers which were good to say the least when we received our order. Rather goto five guys

I gave this place so many chances already but today was its last chance. There is always something whenever I come here by today was just the breaking point for me. So we waited for our food for 1 hour and a half !!!! Our water said that the kitchen lost our ticket after like 40 minutes of waiting so then he had to take our order again and yeah we waited 1 hour and a half for our food, I was so mad and we have had bad experiences before, the staff is just horrible. I do like their burgers but I promised my partner that this is the last time we are coming here because he never liked the service anyway but we would go their because I liked it but not no more. The patty tasted a little burnt btw. Very bad.

waited a half hour for food to arrive in a half empty restaurant. food was ok, definetly not the "yumm" promised in their commercials. the garlic fries are not worth the extra money for the bottomless option as they are under seasoned and bland. the cole slaw is just as bland. it has taken my server 10 minutes now to return with my refilled drink. can only imagine how long it will this sloth to bring my check.
If you want a fake processed burger that sucks go to red robin it's about the same quality as mcdonalds

I had zero issues at this Red Robin, so either they got their act together or we have the typical Staten Island entitled whiners on here. Decent burgers, endless fries. Waiter was excellent and attentive. Food took about 15 minutes to come out (on a Saturday Night). Got my check when I asked for it. Zero issues, you hear that? Zero issues!

I came here today with my sister for lunch while shopping. The service was subpar. The wait staff was nice but when you have one waitress for like 15 tables, you know it isn't going to be great. I'm giving this place 2 stars because the food was decent but that's about it.  We ordered the Guacamole and Salsa with chips for the appetizer. The portion was so small it was ridiculous...the bowl of chips was probably about 8-10 tortilla chips. The guacamole and salsa were good though. Even if you ordered a few different appetizers, the portion would still be too tiny in my opinion.  For the main course, we both had the keep it simple burger which came with toppings on the side and bottomless fries. I only know the fries were bottomless because it said so on the menu but no one ever told us we were entitled to refills.  When our meal was served, I was asked by the runner if I needed anything and I asked for honey mustard sauce which I never received. We just used the salsa and guacamole for the fries. Our waitress did not check on us once to see if we needed anything and my sister didn't have any water or soda to finish her burger. It literally could take one minute to check on someone and she should have came back at least once. No one ever asked us if we wanted more fries or a refill either. We also waited about 10-15 minutes for the check after finishing everything on our table. I doubt this place cares that they have a 2 star rating on Yelp. They are located in the mall which means people will always come here based on convenience. There aren't many options for food in the mall and they know they will always get customers coming in because of their location not their service. I think it's safe to say I will never come back here again.

I think this restaurant is a great addition to our mall which is lacking good places to eat. They have a great variety in styles of burgers and substitutions. I like to opt for a turkey burger and it still tastes great. Also if you're really trying to cut down your carb intake just ask for whole grain or no bun, do not choose the lettuce wrap; you will regret it lol. They also have a good lite lemonade. I've been here several times and cannot complain about the service, all of the servers are are attentive, bring refills for bottomless drinks and fries.

I'm giving this place four starts for the burgers and poutine fries. Which I ordered as an appetizer, portion was way too small for 10.00., but taste was AWSOME, what flavor!!! Service was slow and the place was empty. Alex was our waiter, friendly guy but just not attentive to us once the food came out. My daughters salad was the chicken tender salad with eggs and bacon, came out with just lettuce, tomatoes and chicken. We told our waiter and he brought us a side of bacon when she was nearly done.. Also, check if people need more drinks. Burgers were delicious. I spoke to a manager there who asked if everything was ok and I told her about the missing stuff in the salad and she said that their supplier had a bad shipment of boiled eggs that were contaminated from the asian flu, so no eggs in any red robins. Maybe it's time for them to switch to a different suppliers. This is one thing that worrys me about eating out, not knowing where our food is being processed. I'm thinking now that red robins goes the cheap route and gets stuff from china, not good, not sure if I will be back only for this reason.

ALLERGY FRIENDLY!!!!  They have the most allergy friendly menu I have seen!  I just got diagnosed with Celiac Disease and must avoid all sources of Gluten. I told them I had celiac disease and asked if they had a gluten free menu. They told me the website and my waiter was very familiar with food allergies also. The staff was very knowledgable and I wish all restaurants would follow Red Robin's lead in food allergy awareness!  Loved the online allergy menu and staff was great!

Red Robin is either hit or miss. It has it's good days and then it has its bad days!! Service is terrible but is truly worth it for the delicious food. However The food itself has good days or bad days. You never know what's gonna happen when you enter. It can either be the best food you ever tried or something you dislike.

Red Robin is a frustrating restaurant, the food is good but the service is awful. We went in at 6 o'clock on a friday and placed our order right away and waited 40 minutes for two burgers. We spoke to our waiter multiple times and he basically put his hands in the air and said i don't know whats happening in the kitchen and after another twenty minutes the manager finally did the right thing and brought out our food and took care of the bill for the ridiculous wait.

The service here SUCKS and I do not think I have ever seen or been visited by a MGR - does one exist?  is it ME or is it that EVERY time I go to the SI MALL and eat here the fries are frigidly COLD - old and hard !!!!  EVERY time I eat here I have yet to get hot fresh fries ? WHY? On top of that the burgers are weak and small and over cooked and MY meals have sucked there SO BAD last 3 visits -  I am DONE .................. sadly  I sent in emails - complaints to the store MGR  to Corporate and emailed my feedback NO one replied because NO one CARES !

Came here last week and it was not how I remembered it. The food was overly greasy and salty. I'm giving it two stars because the waiter was friendly and accommodating. My boyfriend and I both felt sick after eating here.

Worse horrible tasting burger that had an egg on top!  Glad I ordered it that way because the only edible part of this meal was the egg and the fries.  Bun had a yeasty taste and the tiny burnt burger was hidden by other fixin's.   Next time I'm in the mall and want a burger - burger king will get my $$.  Consistent edible burger.  Much better than Red Robins horror.  Management should examine Smashburger, Standard Burger and 5 Guys and figure out how they went so wrong. Never again for me.
The chocolate oreo magic dessert is heaven in a glass.
Fries are delicious but you only taste oil for the other food! The place is really dirty and greasy.. the waiter remembered to bring forks and knives just before finishing our meals.

Ok so while visiting the lego displays at the mall we decided to eat here . Geez first of all when we walked in to the establishment the girl at the front podium just continued chatting and laughing with a coworker and didnt even acknowledge us untill i said umm hi can we step inside and sit ourselves or do we have to wait for you ? So then we finnaly sat and waited about 15 mins for anyone to come over and ask us if we wanted anything to drink and or order appetizers ,  but that was ok because our waiter was the kid that just walked in as we were entering too so i understood it wasnt his fault because they should have sent someone else to start us off while he gets ready . So now while we're waiting we noticed they have those new electronic touchscreen thingys on all the tables and that was pretty cool because you can now look at the menu on there and there's games on it for the kids BUT didn't help much with 3 kids trying to play at the same time lol ,It was pretty dead inside and all the tables around us were empty so we asked if we can grab the one on the other table and the waiter apologized and said sorry im not allowed to do that which i didnt understand why if no one is there but no problem i know he doesnt make the rules !! I ordered a burger med rare and onion rings and the kids got chicken fingers and a burger , they split it 50/50 . Now here's where it gets bad , my burger came well well DONE LIKE A DEEP FRIED AND OVER GRILLED HOCKEY PUCK but i didnt say anything and just ate it because i was hungry and i didnt wanna sit too long because if you have kids you know where im coming from lol just wanted to eat quick before the kids started buggin out lol. The onion rings were perfect and the thai dipping sauce was delicious but the fries were blah very boring , just steak fries but thats it . Imo they should season them or something and oh yeah i forgot to mention they have some sort of seasoning on the table but if i have to do it myself then i might as well make my own burger too. Towards the end the waiter came and asked if everything was ok and he noticed half of my burger was just sitting there so i said "dude look at the burger its very well done " and he said " didnt you say med rare " i said yup and he then said wait let me get you a new one and i said naaa man its all good i was starving so just ate some and thats all ,He then sent over the manager who was also a sweetheart . She said ih sir let us give you something else on us amd i said no its ok but thank  you and she said ok im so sorry about that i will remove it from the check which she did. So overall my burger sucked but the onion rings were good , probably my last time visiting this location and I've heard that this is one of the worst ones around. Thanks for the heads up Jason C . Try at your own risk but ill be at millers ale house or somewhere else next time !!
Service is terrible.  Burgers still ok... Fries were terrible.  Service has always been bad, but food was always good.  It's time for new management and kitchen staff! Get it together!!

The service in this restaurant is literally some of the worst I have ever experienced. To start, there is never, ever someone at the hostess stand. You have to wait 5-10 minutes just to be seated. Next, there's no one busing tables. You walk in and there's 10 tables with dirty dishes because no one is going around cleaning them. It takes ages for a server to come to your table, even with the light blinking obnoxiously. And when they do, they're usually rude. There's really no purpose to the displays. If you're gonna have them on the table, let me order from it. I really think the poor service is managements problem. Just because it's located inside a mall doesn't mean the service should suffer. If anything, you have a higher flow of traffic because of your location. Get it together. Get control over your team/restaurant.

Very disappointed. Kids, MIL, and I had a busy day and thought let's go out to eat lunch. We got there around 2 & waited 15 min for a table, not bad. After being seated we waited OVER HALF AN HOUR for our waitress. She came by twice saying she'll be with us shortly. Meanwhile, she didn't take our drink orders yet. After over 35 min, my MIL, asked if she would take our orders. She rolled her eyes as if we were being a nuisance. Btw, we also tried using the tablet that's on the tables but we couldn't order or our water and juices. So we clicked on "call waiter" & it was just blinking. That's probably why she said she would be with us shortly but never came.  I would've complained to the manager but didn't want to get her in trouble. Now thinking back, I should've. It's not my fault she's an idiot! So we left. And had excellent service at TGIF's!!!
My wife and I always sit in the bar area and the service is always friendly and quick. The burgers and appetizers and desserts are delicious. I always get a gourmet burger.

Just OK....customer service wasn't anything to call home about. I had sangria taste like box wine (don't ask how I no that taste lol) the steamed broccoli was just that no extra taste an clam chowder just OK  So I give it an all around OK

I was very disappointed when I was getting ready to walk into red robin and three of the employees were standing outside smoking and told my boyfriend and I that we had to wait five minutes to go in, even though the restaurant had been open for half and hour at that point. They continued to smoke and talk and laugh with each other and it was only when I told my boyfriend we can just go to Applebee's that they told us they were ready and we could go inside the restaurant. At that point we decided to stick with our decision to go to Applebee's. Not a great way to try and get people to eat at your restaurant.

Burger was drier than my dead mother-in-law's feet. The waitress gave us no silverware and our appetizer and entree came out at the same time. I had the All-American patty melt and the meat had no flavor at all. I terrible experience for a Tuesday Afternoon Lunch and the place was empty. I am never coming back her again.

I'm giving it a 3 here because of the Ramen Burger. Just take this off the menu. It's a fad and it's not really done well here. The ramen "buns" are hard and kind of greasy. Honestly, I just pushed them to the side and had the burger and toppings ( which were good!).  So order anything else but this and I'm sure you will be pleased!

To all the parents of kids with food allergies, this review is for you.  My son has multiple food allergies, and so dining out isn't usually an option for my family.  A few months ago, on Father's Day Weekend, I really wanted to take my husband out for a meal and include our son.  To my surprise, many mommy websites listed Red Robin as a great restaurant for customers with food allergies.  I looked up their site and was impressed with their interactive allergen menu.  It helped me eliminate the allergens we were avoiding and gave me a sizeable list of options available for him.        This was one of the best allergen menus I've seen.  It was concise and very thorough,  allowing me to decide on his order ahead of time.  Rather than just stick with one or two "safe options," Red Robin offered a variety of options that custom fit his needs.        We arrived at Red Robin right before the busy lunch orders began, so thankfully there wasn't any wait.  When it was time to order, I told the waitress of my son's food allergies, she wrote it all down and said it wouldn't be a problem.  His food arrived a few minutes before everyone else's, our waitress made sure he had the correct order.  Throughout the meal, she kept checking in on us to see if there was anything else we needed.    We ordered the Burnin' Love burger with Fries, Nacho Crunch Tavern Double with salad & balsamic dressing,   from the Kids Menu & Chicken Stickens from the kids menu.  The Burnin' Love burger was juicy and spicy, it was a nice blend of chipotle and pepper jack.  The Nacho Crunch Tavern was yummy! It wasn't as big as I originally thought, but it ended up being very filling.  The pizza was pretty good, my daughter enjoyed it.  My son ordered the chicken stickens & loved it! He loved being part of the group and not being singled out because of his allergies.  For the first time we didn't have to bring a meal from home for my son, he was able to join us and have his own prepared dish.    At the end of the meal, we paid our bill at our table on the Ziosk Tablet.  No more waiting in line or flagging the waitress down for the bill, everything can be done at the table.  Every restaurant should implement the Ziosk table tablets.  Overall, we had a great Father's Day Lunch and are so thankful to the staff of Red Robin for going out of their way to be professional and caring!

This truly amazed me, the plates were so dirty that you can use your finger to write through the grease. The service is by far the worst. We waited for drinks for at least 15 min, 30 min later the appetizer came out together with entrees. The people next to us been sitting with empty glasses on their table for at least 30 min and not one person attended to them either. This is the worst food spot i ever seen, despite the fact that Mcdonalds has tastier food then these greasy gross tortilla chips and the sloppy over cooked dried meat burger. Sorry for ranting but this place needs a new manager and new waitresses and a dish washer

From the moment we got there, the hostess seemed annoyed that she had to stop texting on her phone.  The ambiance was nice but a little loud.  My food was undercooked, cold, and greasy.  The waitress seemed overwhelmed.   We were very disappointed with this place.

Disappointed. I loved Red Robin and have never experienced bad service as I did this time. Food was good. The problem was how dirty everything was. Seats were dirty from spilt drinks, dishes weren't even cleaned(had entree plate with stains from left over food and water marks and food was directly on it. Had plates with food stuck under them as well. JUST SO DIRTY!). Maybe won't be that way in other Red Robin's but I will NOT be going to the one attached to the STATEN ISLAND MALL.Bad service and unclean- good thing they remembered to bring out food; even if it was like they threw it on the dish like it was left overs.

Thanks..But No Winner... I had never been to this establishment ,we were seated promptly and the waitress was nice and courteous.  But here's where the review begins the unsweetened iced tea was excellent;  but the meal was terribly disappointing.  The appetizers arrived quickly:stuffed mushrooms,cheese sticks & onion rings:  Apparently they did not change the frying oil; they All had a horrible aftertaste!  Which even the dipping sauces provided did not improve the taste. I ordered the "Bleu Ribbon" burger the only thing I ate was the meat itself; the bread and fillings had a weird taste. Also the steak fries had the same weird aftertaste as the fried appetizers. I just left everything on the plate uneaten... talk about a hot mess of a meal. The price for the meal would've been reasonable ..if the food was good; but it was unpalatable. I was really looking forward to have a nice experience there; but I won't be eating at that Red Robin in Staten Island again. I could've went to McDonald, Nathan's or a Diner for a burger & been happier. Wow it's a sad  day when you dine out and leave Unsatisfied! P.S. I tipped the waitress well,because I was not going to punish her ..it wasn't her fault the Food Stunk!

My five stars are for our server today. Today my boyfriend and i ate here on our lunch break and we had a good experience. Our server was a young man named Nicholas, he was great. Very attentive and helpful. Restaurants need more servers like him. Our food was great, I mean is a human being actually capable of making a bad burger? I just didnt like the mayonnaise, i think it was miracle whip. No Human on this planet should use Miracle Whip. Hopefully Trump does something productive and ends the production of miracle whip. (Im just kidding.) This review has gone on long enough. Just know ill be back! And if the manager or owner is reading this review give Nicholas a raise. He deserves it.
The dirtiest restaurant on Staten Island .. the floors are filled with grease throughout the whole entire restaurant including the bathrooms.How does this place stay in business?

By far the worst experience we had ever had , Food came out ok , but service was terrible , waiter never came back to us after food came out , never got dressings for the salad also never got fry's and refill of our drinks, Asked for manager and she said sorry I will take care of the bill , got the check and she lied to us  Never did anything,then ran and hid in the kitchen  And would not come out ,, thank g-d for American Express.  Never again worst. Service ever..

Awful.  Terrible.  Got there at 9pm - they close at 10.  My wife was concerned that getting there so close to closing would mean bad service and food.  I told her she was wrong.  Boy was I wrong.   Service was slow - and there was only 3 tables occupied in the entire place.   Our food came out ice cold.  Everything.  Fries, sandwich, burgers.  My wife sent her sandwich back and it seemed like  they just microwaved it to heat it up.  Even then, the au jus for her sandwich was warm at best.   All our fries (for all 3 orders) were cold.  Waitress said they were gonna make us fresh fries - which is what they should've done in the first place.  By the time the fries came out - we were all done with our meals.  When I indicated that we didn't want the fries because we were done with our food - the waitress replied "well I had to wait for them to make fresh fries" instead of something more appropriate like "I'm so sorry about that, would you like me to box them so you can take them to go?"    During all this the server came to the table 2x - never refilling my empty drink that was on the table.  I was too annoyed to ask for a refill.   I did leave a 16-17% tip - only because it is Christmastime.  Quite frankly - the experience only deserved a 5-10% tip at most.   I live 5 minutes from here and my son loves one of the burgers on the menu -but I will never step foot back in there ever again.

Terrible service !! Burger came out ice cold. Couldn't even complain the waitress never came back to check on us and then dropped the check . Didn't ask if everything was good or if we wanted anything else. Disgrace! Never going back

I've never had a restaurant ruin my day, but it happened. My mom and I stopped here for lunch and it was just...disgusting. We had it on Thursday and we both prayed we wouldn't  get food poisoning afterwards - and we only ordered salad! Both, BOTH of our salads had hair in it (not even gonna comment on the texture of my chicken...you don't want to know), I had to return our silverware because it had water (I assume and I hope) stains all over it, and as if that wasn't bad enough - when I went to the bathroom, this black, clumpy substance came shooting out of the drain on the floor when someone flushed the toilet. It didn't get on me, but it made me sick after what I'd just eaten. We couldn't eat our food so we just paid and left hungry. We were so nauseated by the experience that we couldn't eat our dinner either. I wish someone would call the health department before someone gets really sick.
Burgers are pretty good . Can get pricey for certain items. Service gets slow when busy. Probably need more help for these situations . Eh I like it.

Used to love the burgers of the franchise however this location is not on my list of favorites. Food so so utensils far from clean and not enough staff. Our waiter was ok but not fantastic. Only eat here if there aren't any other places available.

I'm actually shocked that this place has such bad reviews! I love their burgers !!!! The bonzi burger is so delicious! And my service was amazing my dad and I went go here a lot my only complaint was that the hostess was kind of a washed up old hag that wasn't very pleasant or polite.

The food was amazing. Every server seemed really great except ours. He took our order and that's it. He didn't bring our food, didn't refill our drinks, didn't even say bye when we left. I honestly think he forgot about us.

It's a chain, so what do you expect.   I ate here once.  Fries were obviously microwaved.   Our burgers were dry.    Service was awful.   If you want something like this, go to Applebee's, or TGIFridays, both are nearby, and better.
Burger is great. i think its worth it for the amount one pays. On several occassions i ate here, i found service to be good. one of my fav burgers.

Love Red Robin! Typical chain restaurant but I've never had a problem with staff. Always friendly and checked up on what we needed. The Guinness/Jameson milkshake was yummy (and I am not into hard liquor at all!) Ordered the Blue Moon 32oz draft and it was more than enough! Burgers are very consistent!

It is hit or miss. If its good, its great. When its bad, it is horrible. Extreme wait times, lack of attention of our servers, etc. The food is always pretty good, but the service does not live up to other locations we have dined at.

Went today to for an early dinner with my family.  I will say that I'm disappointed my phone died before I actually got my order to take pictures.  For starters we had the "O-Ring Shorty". The sauce (not sure if it was honey mustard or chipotle sauce) was amazing. Very tasty.  For dinner my boyfriend had the bacon cheeseburger well done with chili fries which he says were amazing.  My daughter had their Mac and cheese (picky 2 year old) who did eat all of it so I suppose it was to her liking.  As for me I had the "Turbo-Q Tavern Double" (with yellow American not the Pepper Jack) and was impressed burgers are of a great quality and the fries are well seasoned.  I do believe this place is is understaffed and was in great questioning as to why one of the workers had Christmas Pajama pants on ... lol overall good food.

I'm not a chain restaurant person but my mother loves this place. She is a fan of the tavern burger with just cheese. She just loves burgers from anywhere but I'm harder to please. Bottomless fries is not a draw when there not that good and even if you are a fan have fun tracking down a waiter for a refill. I'll no doubt be there in the future at some point but only to appease my mom.

My family and I came here for quick bite to eat before leaving the mall. My experience was mediocre. I asked for a well done burger, and it came back pink. My family finished eating by the time I got my burger. Our server was very nice. I would add that a gentleman sitting across from us had an accident. His glass shattered whenhe picked it up. Everyoewas prompt to assist him and I overheard the manager saying he'd comp the meal.

After I was sat down at my table, I waited 15 minutes for a waitress to come over and greet me.I almost forgot,  I waited on line for 20 minutes to be seated with about a third of the tables being empty. The service was slow because every time I rang a bell to call for service, it took the waitress 10 minutes to call on me.It was 5:00 and the place was half empty. Finally after a 45 minutes wait when I first sat down,the food didn't look appetizing. The burger I ordered looked flat, no way looking like the picture on the menu. They gave a few french fries, no way filling up the basket like the picture on the menu. It took them additional 20 minutes to bring out the second refill of french fries. The ice tea I ordered was horrible, it taste flat and too sweet. After I paid the bill with my credit card,a woman ran after me in the parking lot accusing me of not paying my tab. She yelled at me like an animal, not showing me any respect. Unfortunately for me,I didn't swipe the card correctly, that is my mistake. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant because they misrepresent their food and the service is slow

This is a chain restaurant so you already know what to expect when you arrive. With that being said I have never had a bad experience here. The staff is always kind and even go out the way to make sure we are good when we bring our son.  On the food side, I always order the same thing. Literally, always the same thing! The Banzai Burger. Never have I had any issues and it's literally amazing. My husband changes it up from time to time and I have never had something he absolutely didn't like. Except the ramen buns, but I think they did away with those. For the food and price this place is definitely good stop.

Another flavorless chain restaurant that resorts to over salting to make their lackluster food have any sort of flavor. I had the Mac and cheese burger and it came out burnt with plain macaroni. Not the first time this has happened but definitely will be the last. I'd rather not waste my money here.

I went there with my friend today, we ordered sangria which was watered down, fried pickles, and a wedge salad as appetizers. The fried pickles were good. The wedge salad was dry, barely any dressing on it. My friend ordered French onion soup, a simple thing off the menu, you can't mess that up, but they did. They served her cold soup, with the mozzarella being a big blob, had to send it back. It was disgusting. She ordered a side order of fries and they give us like 10 fries and when she asked why there was barely any fries the waitress told us cause there unlimited...but still give more than 10 fries knowing that they were being shared. The waitress was also really slow, especially for the place being sooo empty. I don't think I would go back. As we were leaving we asked the lady who stands in the front if they had mints she legit gave us a dirty look and said no nastily because we interrupted her being in the phone. I wasn't happy with this place.

Honestly I should have known better this place has two stars and it's always empty. The waitress was not even attentive despite the fact that no one was in there. We ordered the pickle chips and the wedge salad for an appetizer. The wedge salad hardly had any dressing or toppings on it. I also ordered French onion soup and it literally came out cold and the cheese on top was like a hard block. Like how do you mess up soup? I like my soup to be boiling hot with the melted cheese on top. I also ordered a side of french fries in which I did not know it was free refills until I told the waitress that the first batch came out with literally about 10 fries. It was happy hour so we each got a drink as well. I don't think that this was too bad. First as well as my last time here.

I defiantly enjoyed my time here. It was nice to come and eat after a long day of shopping with friends. The food is very good and the staff are nice. I suggest to not go on busy days like weekends and Fridays because you have to wait for seats and it's very crowded. But even on busy days I was very satisfied with the food and service, and we got sat down pretty quickly. This is my number one go to when I go to the mall!  P.s I suggest getting the pretzel bites and dip then into caramel. It's so good and the caramel is absolutely delicious.
I have been here numerous times because the food is amazing. As far as the service never really had an issues. Yes sometimes I server isn't as attentive but that's in every establishment.

It's typical burgers some are good and priced right and some just have way too much going on and a little over priced. Wait staff is always attentive. Burgers to me seem bland from the ones I have had  Tavern double and the smoke and something ?  Not memorable I guess!  Unlimited fries is a good deal why not carb up right ? Oh and onion rings are ok.

So the burgers are pretty good here but they always take forever to bring the French fries out. When you order your burger it only comes out with like 7 French fires but when you order more (because the fries are bottomless) they take forever to come out. Like 20-30 min. I'm always done with my burger by the time they bring out more fries. It's really annoying.

I have been to different Red Robin's around the country and Canada and always had an amazing juicy Mushroom Swiss burger ..I brought my husband to RR because it was his first time and I haven't RR in a few years and I was truly excited to share this experience......welllllll....I ended up ordering my favorite mushroom swiss and honestly it was no better than Mcdonalds quality...even though I asked for pink the meat was still dry and very minimal mushrooms, burger was not served hot so the cheese was not super melted on a crappy bun ...and I had to add my husband's tomato and bacon to make mine more enjoyable. The fries were also half warm..we didn't ask for second round of fries. His Madlove burger was slightly better mostly bc unlike mine it was actually served somewhat hot..but still didn't taste like a $16 burger. Also we were very shocked that we got charged 1.99 "entertainment fee" for the games on the tablet...we didn't bother fussing about it we're just not coming back. We ended up going to Fiveguys next door and immediately felt the difference. Would not recommend this RR to a friend.

My family and I were seated within 15 minutes upon arrival at this Red Robin location. Service was superb - our female server arrived right away, was quick and addressed each of us as either sweetie or honey.  Food was even quicker. We ordered food for 10+ people and didn't need to wait more than 15 minutes. That was also the problem! All of our burgers were ice cold, as if they were premade and sitting there waiting to be picked up.  I thought the greasy garlic fries were tasty but the burgers were pretty disgusting. I don't recall when the last time I've eaten at Red Robin was, and now I understand why this is so. I likely won't ever visit again.

Waited over an hour and our food did not show up despite large groups who arrived after us getting their food. I'm guessing they forgot to put our order in? They tried to make it better by giving us a plate of fries. We ended up leaving.

Red Robin is a chain known for its burgers and milkshakes. Both the burgers and milkshakes are as promised.  This particular location is strange as it can be VERY hit and miss on cleanliness and service. At times I have been there tables have been pristine and other times have been visibly dirty. Same goes for the service. Sometimes it's great and other leaves a lot to be desired.

First off they don't give military discounts. That's completely unacceptable. How don't you support the military? Second of all it's a burger joint but you can't get your burger cooked the way you want it? Seriously? Third the waiter was very pushy and we will not be coming back here

Was my favorite burger place but the last two times I ate there the experience was not at all satisfying. My food arrived cold, asked to have it warmed then the burger was tough, order cup of coffee that tasted bad and was also cold. My granddaughter's dish was also cold. And the bill was $32.00. Never again!!!!
